org.spongepowered.api.entity.living

Interface Living

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CompositeValueStore<DataHolder,DataManipulator<?,?>>, DataHolder, DataSerializable, Entity, Identifiable, Locatable, ProjectileSource, PropertyHolder, TeamMember, Translatable, ValueContainer<DataHolder>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Aerial, Ageable, Agent, Ambient, Animal, Aquatic, ArmorStand, Bat, Blaze, Boss, CaveSpider, Chicken, ComplexLiving, Cow, Creature, Creeper, Donkey, EnderDragon, Enderman, Endermite, Evoker, Ghast, Giant, Golem, Guardian, Horse, Hostile, Human, Humanoid, Husk, Illusioner, IronGolem, Llama, MagmaCube, Monster, Mooshroom, Mule, Ocelot, Parrot, Pig, Player, PolarBear, Rabbit, Ranger, RideableHorse, Sheep, Shulker, Silverfish, Skeleton, SkeletonHorse, Slime, SnowGolem, Spider, Squid, Stray, Vex, Villager, Vindicator, WhiteSkeleton, Witch, Wither, WitherSkeleton, Wolf, Zombie, ZombieHorse, ZombiePigman, ZombieVillager

    public interface Living
extends Entity, ProjectileSource, TeamMember
    Represents an entity that is living, and therefor can be damaged.

    Living entities can have PotionEffects, breathing air under water, custom names, be meaningfully added to teams, and become invisible.

    • Method Detail

      • getHealthData

        default HealthData getHealthData()
        Gets a copy of the current HealthData.
        Returns:
        A copy of the current health data

      • health

        default MutableBoundedValue<Double> health()
        Returns the health amount.

        The range of the health depends on the object on which this method is defined. For players in Minecraft, the nominal range is between 0 and 20, inclusive, but the range can be adjusted.

        Convention dictates that health does not follow below 0 but this convention may be broken.

        Returns:
        Health value

      • maxHealth

        default MutableBoundedValue<Double> maxHealth()
        Gets the current maximum health.

        The maximum health set here may affect the attribute increasing health points. The base health should be minded that it may be lower than the total maximum health of this entity.

        Returns:
        This entities maximum health

      • getDamageableData

        default DamageableData getDamageableData()
        Gets a copy of the current DamageableData.
        Returns:
        A copy of the current damageable data

      • lastAttacker

        default OptionalValue<EntitySnapshot> lastAttacker()
        Gets the OptionalValue for the last attacker.

        This is generally an entity snapshot of a Living.

        Returns:
        The last attacker as an optional value

      • lastDamage

        default OptionalValue<Double> lastDamage()
        Gets the last amount of damage dealt as an optional value.
        Returns:

      • getHeadRotation

        com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3d getHeadRotation()
        Returns this entity's head rotation.

        The format of the rotation is represented by:

          x -> pitch, y -> yaw, z -> roll

        Note that the pitch will be the same x value returned by Entity.getRotation() and Minecraft does not currently support head roll so the z value will always be zero.

        Returns:
        Head rotation

      • setHeadRotation

        void setHeadRotation(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3d rotation)
        Sets the entity's head rotation.

        The format of the rotation is represented by:

          x -> pitch, y -> yaw, z -> roll

        Note that the pitch (x value) supplied will update the entity's pitch via Entity.setRotation(Vector3d).

        Parameters:
        rotation - Rotation of the entities head

      • lookAt

        default void lookAt(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3d targetPos)
        Makes the entity look at the specified target position.
        Parameters:
        targetPos - Position to target
